page.title: 17The Battle of Camperdown
page.content: {Camperdown Park}takes its name from Viscount Duncan of Camperdown. On the 28th of May 1797 Admiral Duncan received orders to blockade the Dutch fleet under Admiral de Winter. Although his ships were quite inadequate to risk an engagement, Duncan succeeded in keeping the Dutch locked in for several weeks. However, eventually he was forced to return to harbour because his supplies were running out. On his return he found the Dutch out of the trap and ready for him. A fierce battle ensued and, despite their superior numbers,the Dutch were finally defeated. De Winter was compelled to surrender and gave up his sword to Admiral Duncan on board the "Venerable". The importance of the victory was at once acknowledged and Admiral Duncan was honoured nationally and locally.
